en: Portrait of a young woman, called Mrs Cam of Newport, Gloucestershire

A very finely executed miniature. The face has suffered from fading, and the execution of the lips is uncharacteristically clumsy. This may be explained by the possible later reinforcement of the lips, due to the loss of original colour in this passage. 
The pearls and jewels have on some cases lost their silver highlights, which have pulled away the underlying lead white or orange-brown underlayers respectively. In the pendant, the losses reveal fine red lines, which indicated the shape and positioning of the jewels.

UV image: a loss of colour is evident in the lower part of the miniature, which appears bright white under UV light, possibly due to the fluorescence of the parchment support. An orange UV colour is instead typical of lead white and evident in the dress. Other retouched areas are present in the background, towards the top and right edges.
